Detailed Description

Describes a XPath expression that can be evaluated on any node.

This was implemented because we do not have XPath in xercesc on all machines.

Example: Expression( "/rootnode/value" ); Will create an expression to match one hit for value 1 in the following xml: 

     <rootnode>
       <value> 1 </value>
       <value> 2 </value>
     </rootnode>
For example expression: 
   Expression exp( "/rootnode/value*" );
will match both valule 1 and 2 in previous xml.

Example code: 

 XPath::Expression exp( "/rootnode/value*" );
 XPath::Expression::result_type valueNodes;
 
 DOMNode* root = ... parse xml document ...;
 
 valueNodes = exp.evaluate( root );
 if ( ! valueNodes.empty() ) {
   ... do stuff with valueNodes ...
 }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

XMLTool::XPath::Expression::Expression (  const MC2String &  expression,
const MC2String &  nspace = MC2String()
)  [explicit]
 

Creates XPath expression from a string.

The nspace argument is appended to all sub nodes names, i.e "/a/b/c" will be, with namespace "ns", "/ns:a/ns:b/ns:c"

Parameters:
expression a valid expression string.
nspace the namespace name
